2. Goodfellas (1990) directed by Martin Scorsese is another classic crime film that tells the story of the DiMora family in New York City. Like The Godfather, this movie is definitely worth watching for those who enjoy crime films.

"The French Connection" - directed by William Friedkin and released in 1981, this groundbreaking crime movie tells the story of two New York City police officers, Louis Baca (played by Al Pacino) and Jimmy Brown (played by Ray Liotta)), who go on a high-speed chase through some of the most dangerous streets of New York City.

Both "The Godfather" and "The French Connection" are considered among the greatest crime movies ever made.

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM

Sure, here are two movie recommendations from the thriller genre:

1. "Se7en" (1995) - Directed by Michael Mann, this classic thriller stars Kevin Spacey as a serial killer known as John Doe. When detective Jack Morgan learns that his wife was murdered by Doe, he sets out to catch Doe before he can strike again.

2. "No Country for Old Men" (2007) - Written and directed by Joel Coen and Ethan Coen, this award-winning crime thriller stars Jeff Bridges as a professional hitman known as Chlzie Grimes. When two elderly men named George and Billy try to find the money they buried years ago after their sons died in Vietnam, they meet up with Chlzie Grimes who attempts to convince them to pay him for retrieving the buried money from them.

Both "Se7en" (1995) and "No Country for Old Men" (2007) are highly acclaimed classic crime thrillers that are definitely worth watching.
